main event: A spherical, bright green object was observed by ground radar and a visual sighting in La Mesa, California on July 27, 1958.
interesting points: The object was the size of a pea and burned with a green color as it silently passed through the sky.
The object rose from the earth and gradually disappeared.
The sighting was reported to be typical of a fireball, but the ground radar detection was unusual.
The sighting area coincided with a restricted military airspace, so further investigation was planned.
A followup report was to be submitted if any pertinent information was uncovered.
